About Me

Let me tell you about myself.....

BIO

First and foremost, I love writing code. I still remember sitting in front of the lab machine and writing my first C++ code (we all know what that is) and the journey started. Slowly I started implementing data structures using C++ and then slowly moved towards working on my lab assignments. During my senior year, I started learning and using python programming for machine learning.

My passion in the field of Machine Learning and Data Science carried me from Pune, India to Fort Collins, Colorado to attend graduate school at Colorado State University. The 1st class that I took was Introduction to Artificial Intelligence taught by Dr. Asa Ben-Hur. In the spring of 2020, I joined Dr. Ben-Hur's lab and started working on Alternative splicing in the human genome. Gaining ample research experience and knowledge I, will be ailing for my professional career.

My special skills include learning new programming languages and problem-solving. So far, I have Python, C++, Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, MySQL, PL/SQL, Git/GitHub, and various libraries and frameworks like JUnit5, Mockito, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Spacy, NLTK under my belt.

Python
C++
Java
HTML, CSS, SCSS, JS

MySQL, Pl/SQL, and SQL

Colorado State University

Graduate Teaching Assistant

Assist faculty members with classroom instruction, exams, grading, and other miscellaneous projects. Held weekly office hours to provide tutoring or assistance to students for understanding the concepts of data science using python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib. Also Helped students to understand the concepts of SDLC, C++ concepts, CMake build system, and bash scripting.

Colorado State University

Software engineering Intern

Worked on a data pipeline that will simplify the analysis of next-generation sequencing for genomics (sRNA) data. The pipeline was written in CWL (common workflow language) and python wrapper was used.

Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC)

Machine Learning Intern

Project: Machine Translation System for Indian languages

Implemented LSTM, Bi-LSTM, and RNN utilizing TensorFlow library to create a Machine Translation System for 4 differnt Indian languages. Data preprocessing was done using Python libraries like NLTK, regular expression, and NumPy.
